newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian govt needs job emphasis in budget - Oppn.
newsitem.headline: Australian govt needs job emphasis in budget - Oppn.

text.p: Australia's Labor opposition on Thursday urged the government to focus on job incentives in its 1997/98 budget, due to be announced next week.
Opposition employment spokesman Martin Ferguson said Prime Minister John Howard should adopt policies that lead to real employment growth.
"Until now John Howard has had no jobs policy," Ferguson said in a statement.
"Labor recognises that there is a role for government in job creation and job security," he said.
The seasonally adjusted unemployment rate remained steady in March at 8.7 percent, compared with 8.8 percent in April 1996, the statistics bureau said on Thursday.
The estimated number of employed persons rose 37,100 in April to a seasonally adjusted 8.42 million, compared with 8.38 million in March and 8.29 million a year earlier, it said.
